discussion.author: erikmd
discussion.comment:
@CohenCyril thanks for your remark! I've edited the two `Arguments` lines as you suggested (and I also edited the line for `eq_mx` as it also seemed better for consistency).
I force-pushed a new commit (after rebasing on `master` even if it wasn't strictly necessary…)

discussion.author: erikmd
discussion.comment: Hi @CohenCyril! as you had not tagged this PR with the 1.8.0 milestone, I wanted to ask whether you think this could be shipped with the next MC release?

review_discussion.author: pi8027
review_discussion.comment: I personally prefer `finfun g1 = finfun g2` instead of `[ffun x => g1 x] = [ffun x => g2 x]` because it has no eta-redex.

review_discussion.author: erikmd
review_discussion.comment: Indeed, thanks @pi8027! I force-pushed a new version with no eta-redex for {finfun, finset, poly}.

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: At least for consistency, I believe `T` should be made maximally implicit.

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: At least for consistency, I believe `n` and `T` should be made maximally implicit.

review_discussion.author: CohenCyril
review_discussion.comment: I do not think `k` should ever be given explicitly...

review_discussion.author: erikmd
review_discussion.comment: @CohenCyril good point! So I've just put `k` as maximal implicit as well (but feel free to comment if you think it shouldn't be maximal…)

commits.author: erikmd
commits.message:
Add extra eta lemmas for the under tactic

Related: coq/coq#9651
